AZMGApplication_ReadWrite_All.meaning: This edge is created when a Service Principal has been granted the Application.ReadWrite.All permission. The edge is not directly abusable, but is used during post-processing to create abusable edges for privilege escalation via service principal abuse.
AZMGApplication_ReadWrite_All.common: This permission is typically used in automated attack chains and privilege escalation scenarios.

MSGraph_PowerShell.description: Connect to Microsoft Graph with Application.ReadWrite.All permissions
Enumerate target applications for potential abuse

MSGraph_PowerShell.command: # This permission enables creation of abusable edges during post-processing
MSGraph_PowerShell.description: Permission serves as foundation for other attack vectors

MSGraph_API.command: # Obtain access token with Application.ReadWrite.All scope
MSGraph_API.description: Authenticate with required Microsoft Graph permissions

MSGraph_API.command: # Permission enables post-processing for privilege escalation paths
MSGraph_API.description: Foundation permission for automated attack chain discovery
